meanings.definition: Asserting too much or making exaggerated claims.
meanings.sent1: The advertisement was overclaiming the benefits of the product.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her overclaiming statements about her achievements.
meanings.sent3: The overclaiming salesman promised the moon and the stars to his customers.
meanings.sent4: His overclaiming stories made him the talk of the town.
meanings.sent5: The overclaiming description of the event left everyone skeptical.

meanings.definition: The act of making excessive or unwarranted claims.
meanings.sent1: The overclaiming in his speech made it hard to trust his words.
meanings.sent2: Overclaiming in advertisements can mislead consumers.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit exaggerated the concept of overclaiming to hilarious effect.
meanings.sent4: In politics, overclaiming can lead to loss of credibility.
meanings.sent5: The company's reputation suffered due to their overclaiming in the media.

meanings.definition: To claim more than is justified or reasonable.
meanings.sent1: He tends to overclaim his contributions to the project.
meanings.sent2: The author was accused of overclaiming the originality of his work.
meanings.sent3: She decided to overclaim her expenses on the business trip.
meanings.sent4: The athlete was warned not to overclaim his abilities before the competition.
meanings.sent5: It is important not to overclaim achievements to maintain honesty.
